definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Even the much-vaunted state sector is feeling the pinch.
sentences.chinese: 甚至连备受赞誉的国有部门也感受到手头紧的滋味。

sentences.english: If you are getting it into the hands of somebody who is credit constrained, they are going to likely to spend it.
sentences.chinese: 如果把钱给了手头紧的人，他们很可能花这些钱。

sentences.english: When you feel the chips are down, you can come to me.
sentences.chinese: 当你感到手头紧的时候可以来找我。

sentences.english: He says that he is embarrassed at the moment, but he will be able to pay you next month.
sentences.chinese: 他说他目前手头紧，但下个月就可以付钱给你。

definition: to be embarrassingly short of money
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to have a cash flow problem
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to rotate/to circulate (cash, stock etc)/turnover/circulation/cash flow
